ai_explanation.introduction_english: Let's dive into the fascinating world of museums and its Japanese expression - "hakubutsukan." This word is commonly heard when talking about places filled with artifacts, art, and historical displays. Whether you're browsing exhibits or discussing a field trip, understanding the usage of "hakubutsukan" is key!
ai_explanation.meaning_explanation_english: The word "hakubutsukan" means a "museum" in English. A place where various objects of historical, scientific, or artistic interest are stored and exhibited for public viewing.
ai_explanation.kanji_explanation_english: This word is usually written in kana, so there are no kanji to explain.

examples.kanji: 博物館で展示する絵はきれいです。
examples.furigana: 博物館(はくぶつかん)で展示(てんじ)する絵(え)はきれいです。

translations.EN: The paintings on display at the museum are beautiful.
translations.ID: Lukisan yang dipamerkan di museum itu indah.
translations.ES: Las pinturas expuestas en el museo son hermosas.
translations.VI: Những bức tranh triển lãm tại bảo tàng rất đẹp.
translations.FR: Les peintures exposées au musée sont magnifiques.
translations.NE: संग्रहालयमा प्रदर्शनीमा राखिएका चित्रहरू सुन्दर छन्।
translations.ZH: 在博物馆展出的画作很漂亮。
translations.TL: Ang mga larawang nakadisplay sa museyo ay maganda.
translations.MY: ပြတိုက်တွင် ပြသထားသော ပန်းချီများသည် ချစ်ခြင်းမေတ္တာ ဖြစ်သည်။
translations.HI: संग्रहालय में प्रदर्शित की गई पेंटिंग्स सुंदर हैं।
translations.FA: نقاشی‌های به نمایش گذاشته شده در موزه زیبا هستند.

examples.kanji: 日曜日に博物館に行きます。
examples.furigana: 日曜日(にちようび)に博物館(はくぶつかん)に行(い)きます。

translations.EN: I will go to the museum on Sunday.
translations.ID: Saya akan pergi ke museum pada hari Minggu.
translations.VI: Tôi sẽ đi viện bảo tàng vào ngày Chủ nhật.
translations.TL: Pupunta ako sa museo sa Linggo.

examples.kanji: 子供たちは博物館を訪れます。
examples.furigana: 子供(こども)たちは博物館(はくぶつかん)を訪(おとず)れます。

translations.VI: Các em nhỏ thăm viện bảo tàng.
translations.TL: Bumisita ang mga bata sa museo.
translations.MY: ကလေးတွေက ပြတိုက်ကို သွားကြရပါတယ်။
translations.FA: کودکان از موزه بازدید می کنند.

examples.kanji: 博物館の活動は面白いです。
examples.furigana: 博物館(はくぶつかん)の活動(かつどう)は面白(おもしろ)いです。

translations.EN: The activities of the museum are interesting.
translations.ES: Las actividades del museo son interesantes.
translations.VI: Hoạt động của bảo tàng rất thú vị.
translations.FR: Les activités du musée sont intéressantes.
translations.TL: Kawili-wili ang mga gawain sa museo.

examples.kanji: 博物館の展示品はすごいです。
examples.furigana: 博物館(はくぶつかん)の展示品(てんじひん)はすごいです。

translations.EN: The exhibits at the museum are amazing.
translations.ES: Las exposiciones del museo son increíbles.
translations.VI: Các triển lãm ở bảo tàng rất tuyệt.
translations.FR: Les expositions au musée sont incroyables.
translations.TL: Kahanga-hanga ang mga eksibit sa museo.
translations.MY: ဂန္ထဝင်ပြတိုက်ရှိ ပြပွဲများသည် အံ့သြစရာကောင်းပါသည်။

synonyms: 資料館 : しりょうかん : museum
ai_explanation.synonyms_explanation: The most common synonym of the word "hakubutsukan" is "shiryōkan," which refers to a "resource center" or "archive." While both places contain valuable collections, "hakubutsukan" is more focused on public exhibitions, whereas "shiryōkan" often emphasizes documentation and research.
antonyms: 現実 : げんじつ : reality
ai_explanation.antonyms_explanation: The most common antonym of the word "hakubutsukan" is "genjitsu," which means "reality" or "the real world." While "hakubutsukan" refers to curated artifacts that interpret or replicate history and culture, "genjitsu" denotes the everyday, tangible experiences of life outside curated settings.
